alert.note: Alert for Ector (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 14 at 6:02PM CDT until July 14 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Ector County in western Texas... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 602 PM CDT, a dust channel was over Midland International Air and Space Port, or 8 miles northeast of Odessa, moving west at 40 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 91 and 122. Locations impacted include... Odessa, Goldsmith, West Odessa, Notrees, Odessa Schlemeyer Field, Penwell and Pleasant Farms. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust can be unhealthy and has been known to lead to Valley Fever. Avoid outdoor exposure. Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
